Fenomena Desa 'Hantu' Tiba-tiba Muncul Demi Dana Desa
04 Nov 2019, 09:44 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Lamhot Aritonang

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa saat ini banyak muncul desa 'hantu' atau desa-desa baru yang tidak berpenghuni. Desa tersebut muncul tiba-tiba demi mendapatkan alokasi anggaran program dana desa yang sudah dijalankan Pemerintah.Hal itu diungkapkannya saat melaporkan evaluasi kinerja APBN Tahun Anggaran 2019 di ruang rapat Komisi XI dewan Perwakilan Rakyat (DPR), Jakarta Selatan."Sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang nggak ada penduduknya karena adanya dana desa," kata Sri Mulyani, Senin (4/11/2019).Kementerian Keuangan mengalokasikan anggaran dana desa sebesar Rp 70 triliun di tahun 2019. Indonesia memiliki 74.597 desa di 2019, di mana setiap desa mendapatkan anggaran sekitar Rp 900 juta.Dengan fenomena munculnya beberapa desa tak berpenghuni ini sebagai bukti bahwa masih banyak oknum yang ingin memanfaatkan alokasi dana desa secara tidak bertanggungjawab. Padahal, kata Sri Mulyani mengungkapkan bahwa penyaluran anggaran tersebut belum sepenuhnya efektif.Guna meminimalisir kejadian tersebut, Mantan Direktur Pelaksana Bank Dunia ini akan mengevaluasi program dana desa. Salah satu yang akan dilakukannya asalah memperketat aturan pencairan. Dana Desa sendiri dicairkan melalui tiga tahapan. Dana Desa dicairkan dari RKUN (Rekening Kas Umum Negara) ke RKUD (Rekening Kas Umum Daerah) dalam tempo tertentu."Makanya kita mau evaluasi karena adanya transfer setiap bulannya," katanya.Adapun anggaran dana desa disalurkan melalui tiga tahap yakni tahap I sebesar 20 persen, tahap II sebesar 40 persen dan tahap III sebesar 40 persen. Pada tahap I, Pemerintah Daerah diharuskan menyerahkan Perdes (Peraturan Desa) dan APBDes (Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Desa). Tahap II diwajibkan memberikan laporan realisasi dan konsolidasi Dana Desa tahun sebelumnya. Dan pada tahap III memberikan seluruh laporan yang ada di tahap I dan II secara lengkap. 'Phantom' Village Phenomenon Suddenly Appears For Village Funds
Nov 04 2019, 09:44 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Lamhot Aritonang

Jakarta - Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed that currently there are many 'ghost' villages or new uninhabited villages. The village appeared suddenly in order to get the budget allocation of the village fund program that has been run by the Government. It was revealed when reporting the evaluation of the 2019 Budget Year State Budget performance in the Commission XI meeting room of the House of Representatives (DPR), South Jakarta. there are no new residents due to village funds, "Sri Mulyani said, Monday (11/04/2019). The Ministry of Finance allocated a village budget of Rp 70 trillion in 2019. Indonesia has 74,597 villages in 2019, where each village receives budget of around Rp 900 million. With the phenomenon of the emergence of several uninhabited villages as evidence that there are still many persons who want to utilize village funds irresponsibly. In fact, said Sri Mulyani revealed that the distribution of the budget has not been fully effective. To minimize this incident, the Former Managing Director of the World Bank will evaluate the village fund program. One thing he will do is to tighten the rules of disbursement. The Village Fund itself was disbursed through three stages. Village Funds are disbursed from the RKUN (State General Treasury Account) to RKUD (Regional General Treasury Account) within a certain time. "So we want to evaluate because there is a transfer every month," he said. percent, phase II by 40 percent and stage III by 40 percent. In phase I, the Regional Government is required to submit Perdes (Village Regulation) and APBDes (Village Budget and Revenue). Phase II is required to provide a report on the realization and consolidation of the previous year's Village Fund. And in stage III gives all the reports in stages I and II in full.
